titleStmt.title: Thomas Pearce, Sr. et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG1267

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excelency the Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned officers of the Henry Circuit Court and Citizens who are knowing to the facts here submitted; would state to your Excelency that for some years past fines have been imposed by the Jury's in the said Circuit Court agt. person's under Indictments for various offenses -- that executions had from time to time been placed into the Shff's hands of said County on which Success of Satisfaction -- that the Trustee of the Jury fund finding it his duty to renew said Executions and to issue others on Judgments agt. others did on the day of 18 fine cause all of said Executions to issue & placed the same into the hands of C M H late Shff of said County on the day of 18 and that he retained the Same in his hands (hoping that by waiting the Commonwealth might make some of his demands) until the day of 186 thereby subjecting said H as Shff to a motion on the part of said Trustee to at and at the Sepr. Term 1862 of said Court a Judgment was rendered agt. him for the full amt. of all of said Exos ^^ & ^$^ 30 per cent damages for failing to return as afd. Now the undersigned would
respectfully petition, that the Judgt. afd. be by yr. clemency remitted to far as the ComWealth is concerned, and particularly as the said Exos. have been again renewed and now placed into the hands of the present Shff of said County for Collection -- and the ComWealth may by the last Excos receive full satisfaction of his claims agt. the several persons agt. whom fines have been assessed -- & Will We will pray &c

Sep A list of said Exos is here sent to yr. Excellency --
Sepr. 2 1862

Thos. Pearce, Sr,
Thomas M. Buckley D. M. M
I N Webb Judge pro tem
M B. Pearce
County Court Clerk
W. J. Brewer Sheriff ^Elect^
E. P. Thomas late clk H C C C
E. P Thomas Trus Jury fund=
E F Nuttall
B Selby
S. W. Hunt P. M.
J P Sparks
J.. N. Oliver
John J, Berry
S E DeHann
L D Owen Sherriff of Henry
W. J. Thomas D C formerly
C M Mathews
Tho. S. Haydon
